intro: Diplotaxis siifolia subsp. siifolia, commonly known as the African tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to dry conditions. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is also noted for its chemical composition, containing compounds with potential medicinal properties.
